newsitem.title: USA: UAL's United, Varig in marketing pact.
newsitem.headline: UAL's United, Varig in marketing pact.

text.p: UAL Corp said its United Airlines signed a marketing alliance agreement with Varig Brazilian Airlines.

The agreement provides for joint marketing and operational strategies, including code-sharing for passenger and cargo operations. Code-share flights, in which United and Varig flights are coded together in computerized reservation systems, are scheduled to go on sale on September 26, subject to government approvals.

In addition, United and Varig will coordinate schedules to decrease connection times and will offer one-stop check-in, seat assignments and baggage connections for passengers. Passengers also will be able to accrue and redeem mileage from both airlines' frequent flyer programs.

United said Varig will code-share on United flights from New York's John F. Kennedy International Airport, Miami and Chicago to Sao Paulo, Brazil, and from New York and Miami to Rio de Janeiro. United will code share on Varig flights from Rio de Janeiro and Sao Paulo to Los Angeles, Miami, New York, Orlando and Atlanta.
